- Idea 1:
	* Idea 1: ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis (24-hour Intensive)
		- Course spec:
		- - Title: ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis
		- - Target audience: Cross-functional professionals (marketing, ops, finance, HR, legal, product) seeking deep, practical proficiency without coding
		- - Prerequisites: Basic familiarity with ChatGPT; comfort with spreadsheets and PDFs
		- - Total contact time: 24 hours (8 modules x 3:00)
		- - Explicit tool coverage: Advanced Data Analysis (ADA), Browse, Vision (image/PDF/table), Image generation, file uploads/multi-file analysis, Custom Instructions/Memory, Custom GPTs (Builder, Knowledge files, no-code Actions), GPT Store, Teams/Enterprise features (shared workspaces, data controls, privacy)
		- Domain tracks used throughout: marketing, ops, finance, HR, legal, product (learners pick 1–2 tracks for artifacts)
		- Artifact (syllabus): idea01_syllabus.csv
		- - CSV:
		- "course_title,total_hours,module_number,module_title,duration_hh:mm,objectives,tools_covered,assessment_artifact"
		- "ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis","24:00",1,"LLM Fundamentals & Prompt Mechanics","03:00","apply prompt patterns; analyze model responses","Prompting, Prompt frameworks","Checklist of 5 prompts with rationale"
		- "ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis","24:00",2,"Context Engineering & Memory/Custom Instructions","03:00","apply Custom Instructions; evaluate context strategies","Custom Instructions/Memory, File uploads","Personalized instruction set + before/after comparison"
		- "ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis","24:00",3,"Web-Grounded Research with Browse","03:00","apply Browse to collect sources; evaluate citations","Browse, Source management","Annotated 1-page brief with 3 cited sources"
		- "ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis","24:00",4,"Advanced Data Analysis (ADA) for Pros","03:00","analyze CSVs; evaluate chart/summary quality","Advanced Data Analysis, File uploads, Multi-file","ADA report with 2 charts + KPI table"
		- "ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis","24:00",5,"Document & Table Intelligence (Vision)","03:00","apply Vision to extract tables; analyze structure","Vision (image/PDF/table), File uploads","Extracted table (CSV) + accuracy notes"
		- "ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis","24:00",6,"Image Generation & Multimodal Workflows","03:00","apply image gen for drafts; evaluate brand fit","Image generation, Vision","2 image variations + critique against brief"
		- "ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis","24:00",7,"Custom GPTs: Builder, Knowledge, No-Code Actions","03:00","apply Knowledge files; analyze retrieval quality","Custom GPT Builder, Knowledge files, No-code Actions, GPT Store","Custom GPT scaffold + retrieval test log"
		- "ChatGPT Pro Power User: No-Code Productivity and Analysis","24:00",8,"Teams/Enterprise Governance & Capstone","03:00","apply data controls; evaluate workflow compliance","Teams/Enterprise features, Privacy, Shared workspaces","Capstone: end-to-end workflow + SOP"
		- Representative lab script (single exemplar): Module 4 — ADA end-to-end KPI report
		- - Goal: Turn a CSV of quarterly sales into an executive KPI summary with charts and a 150-word narrative
		- - Sample input files: data/sales_q1_q4.csv (columns: date, region, product, revenue, units), data/targets.csv (quarter, revenue_target)
		- - Steps (no-code):
		- 1) Start a new ChatGPT ADA session (Advanced Data Analysis enabled).
		- 2) Upload sales_q1_q4.csv and targets.csv.
		- 3) Paste the sample prompt (below). Approve ADA to inspect files.
		- 4) Review generated tables; ask ADA to merge targets and compute variance% by quarter.
		- 5) Ask ADA to create a bar chart of revenue vs target by quarter; export as PNG.
		- 6) Ask ADA to produce a 150-word executive summary in your chosen domain track.
		- 7) Download chart.png and export a CSV of the KPI table.
		- - Sample prompt:
		- ROLE: Analyst. TASK: Create a KPI summary for quarterly sales. CONTEXT: sales_q1_q4.csv and targets.csv; compute revenue vs target and variance. FORMAT: 1 KPI table + 1 bar chart + 150-word executive summary. CONSTRAINTS: Use clear labels and currency formatting; avoid jargon. EVALUATION: Accurate variance math; chart readability; summary under 150 words.
		- - Expected outputs:
		- - kpi_table.csv with quarter, revenue, target, variance_abs, variance_pct
		- - chart.png (bar chart revenue vs target with annotation)
		- - exec_summary.txt (~150 words, accurate, concise)
		- Pre-course setup checklist:
		- - Accounts: ChatGPT Plus or Teams/Enterprise with ADA, Browse, Vision, Image gen, Custom GPTs enabled
		- - Example datasets/files: 2 CSVs (sales, targets), 2 PDFs (policy, product datasheet), 1 image (screenshot with a table), 1 brand guide PDF
		- - Sample Knowledge files: “Acme_Style_Guide.pdf”, “SOP_Template.docx”, “Glossary.csv”
		- - Teams/Enterprise: Confirm data controls, shared workspace folder, retention policy, org privacy settings
		- - Instructor prep time: 6–8 hours (curate files, test labs, set workspace)
		- Prompt/workflow frameworks included:
		- - ROLE–TASK–CONTEXT–FORMAT–CONSTRAINTS–EVALUATION (RTCFCE)
		- - ReAct-style tool usage: “Think → Decide tool → Act → Observe → Revise”
		- - Checklist prompts: “Before finalizing, check: accuracy, citations, formatting, tone”
		- - Prompt versioning/A-B evaluation: keep v1/v2 side-by-side; choose by rubric (clarity, accuracy, speed)
		- - Lightweight retrieval via Knowledge files: upload PDFs/CSVs, reference by exact filename in prompt
		- Initialized artifacts:
		- - idea01_syllabus.csv (above); idea01_changelog.md (v0.1 initialized; awaiting critiques)

		- Representative lab script: Module 3 — Multi-file KPI pipeline
		- - Goal: Merge ops_metrics.csv and finance_actuals.csv, compute on-time delivery% and gross margin, and produce a KPI dashboard image + CSV
		- - Sample files: ops_metrics.csv (date, orders, on_time_orders); finance_actuals.csv (date, revenue, cogs)
		- - Steps:
		- 1) Open ADA. Upload both CSVs.
		- 2) Prompt to join on date; compute on_time_rate=on_time_orders/orders; gross_margin=(revenue-cogs)/revenue.
		- 3) Ask ADA to produce a KPI table by month; visualize two-line chart (on_time_rate and gross_margin).
		- 4) Request chart export (PNG) and KPI table CSV.
		- 5) Ask for a 120-word cross-functional insight (choose domain track).
		- - Sample prompt: 
		- ROLE: Operations-finance analyst. TASK: Build KPI table and line chart from two CSVs. CONTEXT: Join by date; compute on_time_rate and gross_margin. FORMAT: KPI CSV + line chart PNG + 120-word insight. CONSTRAINTS: Keep rates as percentages to one decimal. EVALUATION: Correct formulas; readable chart; actionable insight.
		- - Expected outputs: kpi_table.csv; kpi_chart.png; insight.txt
		- Pre-course setup:
		- - Accounts: ChatGPT Plus/Teams/Enterprise with ADA, Browse, Vision, Image gen, Custom GPTs
		- - Example files: ops_metrics.csv, finance_actuals.csv, competitor_profile.pdf, press_release.pdf, screenshot_table.png
		- - Knowledge files: “BI_FAQs.docx”, “Metric_Definitions.csv”
		- - Teams/Enterprise: Shared project space; retention = org default; browsing allowed policy
		- - Instructor prep: 7–9 hours (data QA, verify charts, set governance demo)
		- Frameworks:
		- - RTCFCE; ReAct; checklist prompts (metrics defined? filters clear? visuals labeled?); A/B prompt testing; Knowledge file retrieval cues (“Use file Metric_Definitions.csv definitions”)
		- Initialized artifacts:
		- - idea02_syllabus.csv (above); idea02_changelog.md (v0.1 initialized)

		- - Prerequisites: Basic document workflows; familiarity with PDFs/Docs
		- - Total contact time: 24 hours (8 modules x 3:00)

		- Representative lab script: Module 2 — Extract tables from policy PDF
		- - Goal: Extract a policy’s “coverage limits” table from a PDF into clean CSV and validate totals
		- - Sample files: policy_handbook.pdf (3 pages with a table), coverage_limits.png (cropped table image)
		- - Steps:
		- 1) Start a new ChatGPT session with Vision enabled.
		- 2) Upload policy_handbook.pdf; if extraction imperfect, also upload coverage_limits.png.
		- 3) Prompt to locate and extract the table, preserve headers, output CSV with normalized column names.
		- 4) Ask ADA to load the CSV and validate numeric totals and ranges; flag anomalies.
		- 5) Export coverage_limits.csv and a short QA report.
		- - Sample prompt:
		- ROLE: Document analyst. TASK: Extract the “Coverage limits” table and provide a clean CSV. CONTEXT: policy_handbook.pdf (+ optional coverage_limits.png). FORMAT: CSV code block + download + 5-point QA checklist. CONSTRAINTS: Keep currency in USD; standardize header names (snake_case). EVALUATION: Completeness, numeric accuracy, header consistency.
		- - Expected outputs: coverage_limits.csv; qa_report.txt with 5 checks and pass/fail
		- Pre-course setup:
		- - Accounts: ChatGPT Plus/Teams with Vision, ADA, Custom GPTs enabled
		- - Example files: policy_handbook.pdf, employee_handbook.pdf, datasheet.pdf, invoice_scans.zip (images), table_screenshot.png
		- - Knowledge files: “Policy_Glossary.csv”, “SOP_Template.docx”
		- - Teams/Enterprise: Private docs folder; retention rules; viewer vs editor roles
		- - Instructor prep: 6–8 hours (PDF QA, test extraction cases)
		- Frameworks:
		- - RTCFCE templates specific to doc tasks; ReAct with “locate → extract → validate → format”
		- - Checklist prompts for doc QA (headers, totals, page references, omissions)
		- - A/B prompt versioning (structured vs conversational)
		- - Knowledge file retrieval with filename pinning
		- Initialized artifacts:
		- - idea03_syllabus.csv (above); idea03_changelog.md (v0.1 initialized)
- Idea 4:

		- Representative lab script: Module 2 — Knowledge-backed GPT for FAQs
		- - Goal: Build a Custom GPT that answers FAQs from two uploaded documents with explicit citations
		- - Sample files: Product_FAQ.docx; Policy_Guide.pdf
		- - Steps:
		- 1) Open GPT Builder; create new GPT “Team FAQ Assistant”.
		- 2) Define instructions with RTCFCE; set tone and citation requirements.
		- 3) Upload Knowledge files: Product_FAQ.docx, Policy_Guide.pdf.
		- 4) In “Capabilities,” enable file search and disable Actions for this lab.
		- 5) Test 5 FAQ questions; confirm answers quote exact lines with page refs.
		- 6) Save as “Unlisted” and share with team workspace.
		- - Sample system prompt (excerpt):
		- ROLE: FAQ assistant. TASK: Answer using only Knowledge files with page-line citations. CONTEXT: Product_FAQ.docx, Policy_Guide.pdf. FORMAT: Direct answer + bullet citations. CONSTRAINTS: Say “I don’t know” if not in sources. EVALUATION: Accuracy, citation fidelity, completeness.
		- - Expected outputs: Working Custom GPT; test_log.csv (question, answer_ok, citation_ok, notes)
		- Pre-course setup:
		- - Accounts: ChatGPT Plus/Teams/Enterprise with Custom GPT Builder enabled
		- - Example files: Product_FAQ.docx, Policy_Guide.pdf, Brand_Guide.pdf
		- - Teams/Enterprise: Workspace sharing enabled; org policies reviewed; publishing permissions clarified
		- - Instructor prep: 8–10 hours (prepare Knowledge sets, test retrieval, set sharing)
		- Frameworks:
		- - RTCFCE; ReAct for retrieval/grounding; checklist prompts for “cite or abstain”; A/B system prompt variants; Knowledge scoping (split docs, consistent filenames)
		- Initialized artifacts:
		- - idea04_syllabus.csv (above); idea04_changelog.md (v0.1 initialized)

		- Representative lab script: Module 3 — Image generation from brand brief
		- - Goal: Generate two on-brief hero images for a landing page and justify selection
		- - Sample files: Brand_Guide.pdf; reference_moodboard.jpg
		- - Steps:
		- 1) Upload Brand_Guide.pdf and reference_moodboard.jpg.
		- 2) Prompt to extract brand palette and visual constraints from Brand_Guide.pdf via Vision.
		- 3) Generate 3 initial images; refine to 2 final variations based on feedback criteria.
		- 4) Ask for a rationale comparing the two against the brand constraints.
		- 5) Export images and rationale.
		- - Sample prompt:
		- ROLE: Brand designer. TASK: Generate hero images on-brief using the brand guide. CONTEXT: Brand_Guide.pdf and moodboard image. FORMAT: 2 images + 120-word rationale comparing them to brand constraints. CONSTRAINTS: Respect color palette and typography mood; avoid photorealistic people. EVALUATION: Brand fit, clarity, reusability.
		- - Expected outputs: hero_v1.png, hero_v2.png; rationale.txt
		- Pre-course setup:
		- - Accounts: ChatGPT Plus/Teams with Vision, Image gen, ADA, Browse, Custom GPTs
		- - Example files: Brand_Guide.pdf, moodboard.jpg, three sample articles (PDF), readability_benchmarks.csv
		- - Knowledge files: “Content_Templates.docx”, “Brand_Terms_Glossary.csv”
		- - Teams/Enterprise: Shared creative folder; approval workflow documented; retention set
		- - Instructor prep: 6–8 hours (test prompts, curate brand guide)
		- Frameworks:
		- - RTCFCE tailored to creative briefs; ReAct for iterate→critique→refine cycles
		- - Checklist prompts (tone, brand compliance, accessibility)
		- - A/B versioning with ADA readability and sentiment scoring
		- - Knowledge file templating for reusable content blocks
		- Initialized artifacts:
		- - idea05_syllabus.csv (above); idea05_changelog.md (v0.1 initialized)

		- Representative lab script: Module 3 — Multi-file analysis and reconciliation
		- - Goal: Reconcile a product PRD (pdf) with a sprint backlog (csv) to produce a gap list
		- - Sample files: PRD_v1.pdf; sprint_backlog.csv (id, feature, status)
		- - Steps:
		- 1) Upload PRD_v1.pdf and sprint_backlog.csv.
		- 2) Prompt to extract PRD features, match to backlog, list gaps/mismatches.
		- 3) Ask for a prioritized gap list with suggested owners.
		- 4) Export gap_list.csv and a 1-paragraph summary to share.
		- - Sample prompt:
		- ROLE: Product operations analyst. TASK: Reconcile PRD and backlog to identify gaps. CONTEXT: PRD_v1.pdf + sprint_backlog.csv. FORMAT: gap_list.csv + 1-paragraph summary. CONSTRAINTS: Prioritize by impact and readiness. EVALUATION: Correct matching, clear priorities, actionable owners.
		- - Expected outputs: gap_list.csv; gap_summary.txt
		- Pre-course setup:
		- - Accounts: ChatGPT Plus/Teams with ADA, Browse, Vision, Image gen, Custom GPTs
		- - Example files: PRD_v1.pdf, sprint_backlog.csv, policy.pdf, brand_guide.pdf, sample_data.csv
		- - Knowledge files: “Team_SOPs.docx”, “Glossary.csv”
		- - Teams/Enterprise: Workspace with shared folders; retention; role-based access configured
		- - Instructor prep: 6–8 hours (assemble files, test reconciliations)
		- Frameworks:
		- - RTCFCE; ReAct; checklists for reconciliation (mapping, conflicts, missing info)
		- - A/B prompt versioning for extraction vs synthesis prompts
		- - Knowledge file pinning for domain glossary
		- Initialized artifacts:
		- - idea06_syllabus.csv (above); idea06_changelog.md (v0.1 initialized)
